newsitem.title: USA: Ellett Brothers sees Q2 EPS $0.01 to $0.03.
newsitem.headline: Ellett Brothers sees Q2 EPS $0.01 to $0.03.

text.p: Ellett Brothers Inc said second quarter earnings appear to be $0.01 to $0.03 per share, before a one-time restructuring charge, compared with $0.07 per share in the second quarter last year.
The company said preliminary financial results for the second quarter show the first signs of improvement in 10 quarters in the hunting and shooting sports segment of its distribution business.

But the company said an evaluation of the second quarter results has led to a decision to shut down its Safesport Manufacturing Co subsidiary, which will result in a one-time restructuring charge for the quarter.

The company said that if it could exclude Safesport from the results each year, its EPS would have been $0.08 to $0.10 in the second quarter compared with $0.07 last year, and $0.19 to $0.21 for the first six months this year against $0.17 last year.
The company issued a news release saying its internal projections showed the company could lose more than $1 million after taxes in Safesport this year if Safesport continued operations.
